Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place.”
Reviews.Author: Marek_Texas
Reviews.Content: Location in Thai Town about a mile from Hollywood walk of fame and free parking. My room door card key did not work, the door had half inch gaps, cracks in walls an the whole place needs total remodeling. I will not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: nanibabang
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a bad neighborhood. The lady at the front even told us to walk toward the main attractioins n to avoid everything else. She also suggested that the ladies not walk alone at night! The room looked really run down. There was a crack at the bottom of the door so you can see outside. The door didnt close at first so we called someone. He said we needed to stand a wait a second for it to restart and then try again. In order for me to lock the door at night, I needed to lift the door handle then lock it. It looked damp and musty inside. It was dusty and felt dirty. The front windows did not lock(it was broken). We had a fridge but it did NOT work and the freezer was filled with old water from who knows how long. In another room we had, the windows did not lock and neither did the sliding door. I was held closed by a stick! Also, there was a cable box, but there was not outlet connecting it to the wall, so it defeted the purpose of having it there to begin with. I do not recommendd this place to anyone and will not return. The pictures really need to be updated because it looks nothing like it!

Reviews.Title: “hollywood gem”
Reviews.Author: FrankG1955
Reviews.Content: Quirky but very good hotel in a convenient location, near to metro station and Hollywood attractions. I wish I'd found out about this hotel for my earlier stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PriscillaMay
Reviews.Content: As others have said, you learn the meaning of "you get what you pay for" here. It's a budget hotel and doesn't pretend to be otherwise. Good location, great free parking right next door. The room was clean but looking pretty shabby - the whole place looks like it has been prepped for a re-paint that never got done! We stayed in two different rooms on separate weekends - the first bed was really soft and springy but the second was much better and nice and firm. Clearly the rooms vary a lot! The staff are really friendly and helpful. The breakfast is basic but there's quite a lot of choice and a waffle maker so you can make your own. There were building works going on next door which were a bit noisy, but not their fault. Also some loud guests who stopped screaching when we called front desk to ask them to turn the volume down on these people! I would recommend this place to the budget traveller who's not looking to spend very much time in their room!

Reviews.Title: “Three reasons to stay:”
Reviews.Author: cbgfree
Reviews.Content: Price with the rule "you get what you pay for" in mind; free parking; in town location. This hotel is 40-50s and hasn't seen an infrastructure repair or upgrade since new except for the door card lock. Examples: electrical outlet dangled from the wall; no commode tank top or counter top in bathroom for stuff; tub so old bottom worn thru to core. The building is two story with steep stairs - no elevator. Bottom line: overdue for overhaul ceiling to floor. In any city except Los Angeles, rooms would be $30 a night or less, get a sub par rating or perhaps be out of biz due to failed city inspections. The in-town location is great but it comes with caveats - the office is kept locked at all times and check in procedure requires a copy of drivers license to be kept in the office for police access, according to staff. That was a first for me & I travel a lot. Contrary to other reviews, I found the front desk female both friendly when conversation was the extent of her required involvement and resistant when I required actual assistance. Her unprofessional behavior went far beyond not having a good day. Breakfast was on par with chains offering free food. All that said, if you view the hotel only as a place to drop your bags, sleep and go, the three reasons to stay will work fine; just arrive with expectations in check. I didn't and was stunned. The web pictures gave the impression of quaint. Not so. It's merely old and rundown.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: L T
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, was l pleasantly surprised by the free breakfast. Room wasn't the flashest but very decent for the price. Front desk staff were really friendly and helpful - helping us find a place to eat at 10pm on Christmas Day. Location is great and they were nice enough to allow us to have a late check out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: TaylorVegas
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff and a great breakfast. The staff were very helpful and its close to walk to everything and only a 5 minute drive to Universal Studios. Its good for the money you pay and our rooms were cleaned every day. My friends and i had a great time and i would stay here again on my next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO GET ROBBED!”
Reviews.Author: Lettersvsnumbers
Reviews.Content: Our car was broken into and rifled through right in front of the door. Very unsafe area and rude owners!!!

Reviews.Title: “KEEP WALKING”
Reviews.Author: barrie m
Reviews.Content: Rooms badly renovated,bad location,breakfast looks nothing like the web page,toilet works when it wants to,shower water runs away from the drain,tv OLD,building sad, reception locked,GIVE IT A MISS.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Helpful and Convenient Plus - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ladybirdladybird111
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights on my own here - I had not pre booked and walked in, which I would only suggest if you hadn't already booked somewhere (they were actually pretty busy so I was lucky) - and upon arrival I was greeted by friendly young staff who may have been new but you can't really hold that against anyone - the only time you should be in a huge rush on holiday is when you're on the way to the airport! The room was fresh and clean, spacious and a big relief from what I expected I may have walked into randomly on Hollywood Boulevard. A good, powerful shower with complimentary soaps, tea and coffee and a television. There is a pool, although I didn't use it as being I was on my own and out most of the time - probably more suitable for families staying, you may as well make the most out of it. The morning breakfast was quite nice; a soya option would be good but not that many places do soya funnily enough. There are several options; waffles, eggs, fruit, juice, coffees... This place has free wifi and generously allow guests to use their personal laptop inside the office if they need to. It is family run, which adds a nice touch to a venue, and the managers are very friendly and helpful. They know the city so ask them what's where and how if you need to. Hollywood Downtowner Inn is also affiliated with a taxi service a few doors up which gives you a much better deal on cab fares than the regular Hollywood cabs, and Bechir also knows his way around. I travel on my own a lot and as a female this can be tricky in certain places - I've developed a pretty good intuition for picking out the good from the bad, and these are good people who are happy to help and want to see you have a good time. I've stayed in plenty of places where people really don't give a [--].

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: L B
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Downtowner Inn is a good place to stay; nice and clean rooms, a swimming pool, near Universal Studios (a ten minute ride), free parking space and the breakfast is also great! Hollywood Boulevard is a short walk. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: KelleyFamily06
Reviews.Content: I specifically booked a suite with separate living room and bedroom so that teenagers and adults have privacy. Was assured that was what I was booking. When I got there, there was no such suite available. The hotel is in a bad area of Hollywood. All businesses around it have bars on windows. Hotel's lobby is locked shut. While we were there asking to have our reservation canceled, a disoriented person tried to get in, but desk clerk would not unlock door. We wanted our reservations canceled, but desk clerk refused. We left there and found a wonderful Hotel 6 on Whitley Street less than a block off of Hollywood Blvd. in a nice area. Hollywood Downtowner still charged us for the room we had reserved. My advice, don't choose this hotel. Check out the Motel 6 on Whitley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel a Big Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, the family that runs it could not be any nicer, they were most helpful with any request we had and helped with directs and the best places to eat at night, the room was a good size, the bed was comfortable, the sheets where nice and clean and we got clean towels very day. They have the best free hot breakfas and free car parking, it was in a great location from the highways the metro and the bus ran passed the door, it is in walking distant of the Chinese theatre, we were very surprised with this hotel and would recommend it to any-one, yes it is old but it has the 1930 movie style feel about it just wonderful. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Natalie1986
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner for 5 nights at the end of March 2011. The location was great as it is only a 5 minute walk to the Hollywood walk of fame and Kodak theatre. I stayed in room 6. The room was a decent size and the bed was very comfy. The bathroom had a good shower in and looked modern. The room had a fridge and a tv with more channels than you could ever need. I loved the breakfast. It is in the building next door but it is only 60 seconds from the rooms. They had fresh fruit, toast, bacon, egg, pancakes, juices, cereal. The staff were very friendly. They had a pool which looked clean and well maintained but it was too cold to go in at this time of year. I enjoyed my stay that much that I booked to stay again for 4 nights on my return from Vegas. When I stayed the second time I book the room opposite room 6. It had a double bed, plus a single and a seperate kitchen with a table. The room was much bigger and it was the same price. It also has free wifi and free parking. The only hotel in Hollywood for this rate and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Been there...done that...and didn't like it”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: I think we were given the worst room in the place...even though I had booked it months in advance. Our room had a creepy dark vibe...not much room to move around...and the view of the Hollywood sign couldn't be enjoyed due to the window being absolutely filthy. I did ask if we could be moved to a different room...but got no response...and it actually became depressing toward the end of our stay. We knicknamed it our 'prison cell' The hotel offers complimentry breakfast every morning which is hosted by the nearby diner. That was the only good thing. Location is very poor...having to walk past homeless people who line the street outside. That made the stay even more depressing. Time seemed to drag on...and when our prison sentence was over...I was so glad when got to pack up and leave. Would I stay again?.....NOPE

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel Great location and Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jaystant21
Reviews.Content: The location is just minutes from anything in Hollywood you could wish to visit. Free parking and the Breakfast are the redeeming features of this Hotel. There are many things that could be improved such as the cleaning of the room. The Television automatically closing down every 60 minutes. Our room was insecure because the patio doors to the balcony were secured by a broom handle, and the glass was cracked. Other health and safety issues were the overloading of the sockets and an eclectric point in the bathroom above the sink. It was also quite noisey at times as some guests do not know how to consider others. Breakfast was in a cafe two doors down from the Hotel. It was the best breakfast I have ever had in the states.You could make your own waffles

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pippy12
Reviews.Content: Grotty run down motel! Do not even think about staying there for another couple of dollars you can get nicer. 3inch gap for the cockroaches to get through the door, main door not even that secure. Ensuite is a joke tv is set on a timer to go off every hour which is really annoying, staff ok pool is really small and does not look that clean. Breakfast two doors down was nothing great but it has a A on the window which means it's clean which is a positive.

Reviews.Title: “nice and good value”
Reviews.Author: NikoletaL
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 night at the hotel, the room, bathroom and linens were clean, they have free internet and breakfast included, free parking. Don't expect too much from breakfast, but they at least provided some. Stuff very helpfull, room big, with a fridge, not even needed such a big one, the first impression is that it is very old. It is old fashioned, but if you just need a clean shower to wash and a clean bed to sleep... perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as on the pictures”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDW
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online based on the photo's. It looks half decent on the photo's but in reality it is not as nice. The room was very basic and the bathroom, though clean, had seen better days. The reception staff was very helpful and friendly. A full breakfast was provided in partnership with a local restaurant, which was very nice. The restaurant however was too small to accommodate all the guests. The hotel is walking distance from the Walk of Fame, which too is nicer in photographs than in real life. Hollywood, on the whole, to be fair was a bit of a disappointment. I would not want to be going for a walk later in the evening. The hotel too was walking distance from the underground Metro, which takes you to Universal Studios and central LA.

Reviews.Title: “They gave my room away”
Reviews.Author: Ojaicindy
Reviews.Content: Reserved my room a week in advance to stay after a concert at the Bowl. Rushed to check in before the concert only to find they had overbooked & had given my room away after I had driven nearly 3 hours to get there. They claimed they did not have my phone or address despite the fact that I had provided them when making reservations and received my reservation confirmation via e-mail. They "arranged" for me to have a room nearby and generously volunteered to pay the difference of $5 . I would have graciously accepted the offer had the hotel been comparable but it was not. It wasn't even close. I ended up late to the concert and driving home several hours afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood attractions, let down by noise, maintenance & cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: RobertNeave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago and based on our previous enjoyment we stayed again. When we stayed before apologies were made that the room we were staying in was in the process of being redecorated this was OK, however when we stayed this time we were disappointed to find that our room for this stay was in a worse condition than the one we stayed in last time. We were in room 22 which we were given as we had requested a king sized bed with a kitchenette and balcony. We got a comfortable king sized bed (sheets not changed during stay) with an ajoining kitchenette which literally consisted of a coffee maker, fridge, microwave, some cupboards and sink. There was no cutlery or crockery to eat microwaved foods with which was quite inconvenient and frustrating to locate in the local supermarket. The window in the kitchen had nothing to secure it with, not a security issue as we were 3 stories up but it was not attractive at all being very dirty, rusty and held closed by pieces of duct tape on the glass. We did get a balcony, but unlike most of the balconies at the hotel it was not private -it was actually a walkway for other guests to get to their room. This meant it was very noisy through the thin balcony door and we were unable to open all the curtains to let the gorgeous sunlight in, as anyone could have peered in. In fact, for 2 days someone from a neighbouring room that did not have a balcony at all decided to park themselves in front of our window to read a book. There were 2 rooms opposite us and 3 more below, positioned as our room was at an intersection of rooms at the top of a flight of stairs. THe noise at night and in the morning from other families (children mainly running around, shouting) was awful. Doors slamming, shouting, parents telling children off. Add to this the incredibly loud air con... Sorry to say we did not feel safe in our room, as it was at the end of the hotel and our balcony door was accessible to anyone who ventured into the hotel. Had we had a private balcony we would have felt safe as it is not a bad area really, we felt safe walking through it during the day and at night it was just in the hotel that we felt vulnerable. If you stay then make sure you request a private balcony! There were ants in the bathroom which we reported but were not dealt with. The doors in our room had chips out of them and there were stains on the carpet.We had to clean the bathroom before we used it as it was quite dirty. The hotel is situated in a great place, located as it is on Hollywood Boulevard. It is worth noting this is a very busy road and as such very noisy. Not the hotel's fault, but ther it is it is a noisy location with sirens and traffic noise all through the night worse of course at weekends. On our first trip to the hotel the owners were readily available and very helpful, but now the breakfast is at a local cafe and not available form the front reception we did not interact with the owners at all except to check in and out, and they really seemed disinterested in our holiday and our eperience of their hotel. We liked that our bed was made each day (although sheets not changed)and that the hotel offers free parking. We were happy that the hotel was a 40 minute walk from Grauman's Chinese Theatre. We were not happy that the bathroom was not cleaned when the towels were replenished. It was frustrating that the coffee provided for the coffee maker was incostintenty replenished, so some days we could not make coffee. We will not be staying at the Hollywood Downtowner Inn again, at around $75 per night we would rather spend a little more and have the basics for a good holiday in place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nearby Thaitown”
Reviews.Author: Toonn
Reviews.Content: A yellow small hotel we can trust. The building is not modern but it's good value to stay with. I love this family-owned small hotel. Staff here, they are like our family. You can ask them for the direction and attractions. They are welcome to assist you. I like a hot breakfast here, sausage, bacon, scramble aggs, orange juice, milk etc. Free wi-fi available for all rooms. This hotel is very closed to LA subway. Only 2 stops to Hollywood Highland, 15 mins to Universal Studio. If you love Thai food, here is the best choice. It's only minutes walk to Thai town. You can find various thai food such as; spicy soup, rice with curry, noodles and thai desserts. I highly recommend Pailin Thai Cusine, very closed to the hotel. Very yummy and authentic Thai food!!

Reviews.Title: “good place, close to hollywood but a little dirty”
Reviews.Author: sebsahib
Reviews.Content: the place had a good offer compared to other hotels and its definitely worth staying in Hollywood instead of LA Downtown. The Hotel has some good rooms and some rooms closer to the street whcih can be a little noisy. There is a swimming pool but its so small that they should replace it with a nice green garden instead. Rooms were a little dirty but ok for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Safe”
Reviews.Author: cryingsin_
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hollywood Downtowner, my mother and I, it's a small hotel, but serves its purpose. They have open garages that you can use to park your car in. It's a short drive away from everything. The room was old and could use some new paint, but for what youre paying and how close it is to everything it was fine. I saw no bugs, and had no problem sleeping through the night. The little kitchen area with a microwave and fridge is nice, we would have used it if we stayed longer. All in all it was a great little place for cheap. And the management was really great. They are available at all hours. We needed their help at 230 am, they had no problem helping us and were very nice. I would definitely recommend staying here for anyone on a budget. And the morning breakfast at the Transylvania was AMAZING. We thought that was a very neat feature.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with everything, can´t believe some reviews”
Reviews.Author: maiafridman
Reviews.Content: I was really scared about what we would find, however we are really pleased with the hotel, owners, service in relation with the price! It´s obvious that for this price you´ll not stay at a star ranked hotel, but it´s clean, safe and comfortable for the price. Our room had microwave and fridge what was very convenient; the breakfast was included in a coffee shop next door (buffet breakfast, not just toast and burned coffee, it was very good); everyone was very nice and helpful about info, and even we were able to check in earlier because our room was ready. I have nothing to complaint about. No luxury, but we already knew that. I would defintely stay there again if we got back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place!”
Reviews.Author: broskvarpa
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 10 nights and we are both very satisfied. The hotel is clean, the room looks like it has been recently renovated. You have all you need: clean sheets and towels every day, a fridge, a microwave, a TV, a coffeemaker and warm water in the shower. The inside with the pool is very cosy with a lot of nice plants. The staff is also very helpful! We definitely don't agree with the negative reviews here. The hotel is located very strategically next to a metro station only a couple of stations from Hollywood Vine and Highland. If you don't have a car or plan to rent one, this is a very good place to stay at. We recommend you using the metro.. It is cheep (5 dollar for a day pass) and fast and good for the environment.

Reviews.Title: “tooooo bad :((”
Reviews.Author: Scarletdiv
Reviews.Content: Couldn't spend more than 1 night in that motel, had to check out and move to another hotel in WeHo. The room was tired, dusty and smelly, with stains on carpet, bugs in the bathroom, old firniture, torn sheets and towels_ should i say more? but the worst thing was the AC which was noisy as airplane. twas completly impossible to sleep! My friends stayed in the renovated room, which was a bit more cozy, but still very poor! Better spend 50 dollars more and stay in a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location (if you don't mind traffic noise)”
Reviews.Author: sallymarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights after arriving LA en route to Palm Desert and Las Vegas. The room we were allocated (30) unfortunately faced the front and was extremely noisy as it faces directly onto Hollywood Boulevard which is an extremely busy road with taffic 24 hours a day. On the plus side, our room was large, relatively clean with an up to date bathroom with large shower. We had a huge comfy bed and a fridge and microwave too. We didn't feel nervous walking in the area at night and walked around 20 minutes to a really nice restaurant (Poubelle) one evening and ate at a cheap Thai on the other (within two minutes walk) which only took cash and didn't serve alcohol. Breakfast was served in the "Transylvania Restaurant" a couple of doors away and was copious and of good quality. The owner was a Hungarian who had been living in Transylvania and was quite chatty. Overall, the area is a bit rundown (with closed and shut down stores etc) but we didn't spot any hooligans hanging around etc. If arriving at LAX, please note that the taxi fare is horrendous! We paid $65! Our hotel owner gave us good advice about catching metro and getting the shuttle bus from Grand Station which was a far cheaper option and really easy to do. We didn't particularly enjoy LA as we found it rather dirty and run down but others might see it differently. Nevertheless, we had good hospitality at the Downtowner and I would recommend it as a budget stop over but don't expect frills.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: planetwonderer
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be clean and very comfortable. The staff were more than willing to help out in any way and the breakfast in the next door cafe was fantastic. We found the only problem was with noisy neighbours who came in at all times. The owner had words which helped and overall we had a great stay. We would have loved to have used the pool which was supposed to be have been heated but wasn''t. Great location and metro red line "Hollywood/Western" only a 5 min. walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Free Breakfast & Free Parking”
Reviews.Author: Little_Traveller80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner for 2 nights. I read reviews on trip adviser before booking the hotel and it is as described by others. The free breakfast is nice and the hotel location is close to Hollywood attractions (20 min walk) and the subway station (5 min walk) for our trip to Downtown LA. The room is not 5 star quality but it was clean. It was a bit noisy in the evening from trucks passing on the road but once asleep you couldn't hear a thing. Would recommend this hotel for anyone who is visiting Hollywood/LA for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for little money”
Reviews.Author: TokkeVD
Reviews.Content: I don't understand these extremely bad reviews.. We stayed 3 nights in Aug 09 while visiting the city: Friendly desk personnel (granted us a late check-out without extra charge - gave us directions to nearby public transoport, eateries, places of interest,...), old but clean rooms, super breakfast in eatery next door, free wifi, free parking... Like i say, old room (not freshly painted, not recently plumbed etc) but very clean, hot water, comfy bed. More than enough for the small amount of time you spend in there. Great location, free parking is huge surplus as is the very nice breakfast (waffles, pancakes, sausages, egg, cereal, fres fruit, yoghurt, toast, good coffee). Will go there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE! Decent Hotel/ Great Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: JustBeauty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner for 3 nights (7/5 thru 7/8). Though not the Ritz Carlton or Beverly Hilton, the Downtowner does have some pluses of its own. It is a small motel, reminiscence of a Melrose place-type of apartment. There is a small (7ft deep) pool in the center courtyard surrounded by flowers. It is hard to get in and out the pool due to the gate that surrounds it. The pool changes colors at night, from blue to green to red. My room was nice (#24), decent and comfortable. Again, not a fancy place. There was 2 beds, a kitchenette in an adjoining room, a decent size bathroom (with great water pressure and HOT water!), and a walk-in closet/storage room. The room came with a view of the center courtyard from the kitchenette and view of holly hills from the bedroom. The room came with 2 queen beds (semi-hard, I’m not fussy about bed-softness), a desk, vanity mirror, TV with digital cable, and vanity self adjacent to the bathroom, and dresser. Overall, very decent, quiet, and perfect for a nights rest. The location is on the "less-than-fancy" side of Hollywood blvd. Not a horrible area (I’m from NY originally, so when other people said "bad neighborhood" I was expecting a lot worst). The Translayannia restaurant serving the continental breakfast was wonderful! FULL breakfast complete with pancakes, make-your-own waffles, coffee, tea, orange juice, sausage some days, bacon the others, hash browns, eggs, fruit, cottage cheese, and yogurt! ALL FREE! Traveler's tip on getting the most out of your stay -Use the METRO! to LAX: 1hr & 15mins, 3 trains from the hotel, very convenient and cost me less than $3.00! Nearest exit to the hotel is Hollywood and Western, about 3 minute walk from the hotel doorstep. - Buy the StarLine HOP ON HOP OFF tour! The tour travels through: the Westside/Santa Monica/Beaches, Hollywood, Downtown LA, and Universal. -EAT EAT EAT the continental breakfast at Translayennia Restaurant! -Hit Universal CityWalk for nightlife and entertainment!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty little secret motel”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because of a Suicide Girls pictorial I saw that was shot here. Is that a good reason? whatever. The fact is when In stayed here there were rocker chocks giggling all night in the room next to mine which made it worth while. The room was small, scented of inhabitance past, dark, old and stained which in some weird aspects is a turn on. A pool of tiny measure is in the court yard but I would even think of swimming in it. I guess I would say this place is perfect for a secret rendez vous for nobody would ever look for you here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reports”
Reviews.Author: fpchef
Reviews.Content: I had a very clean room (11) and it was close to where my meetings were. Free parking and very good hot breakfast (from 7:30am) included from restaurant next door. It was a very cool weekend so I did not use the small pool. Owners were very nice and answered all questions that I had about the area. My only complaint was that the wall are thin and it was on the noisy side. I didn;t sleem much the first night. I turned the window/wall unit on the second and third night and it helped drown out almost all of the street noise. I did not notice much noise from other guests. For the cost, location and free parking I would be back.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterWilko
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights. Got absolutely no sleep. Aside from the racket of the traffic, parties in rooms all over the place till the early hours. Management not particularly bothered. Tatty old room with wires hanging down the walls from air con/ fridge/ microwave. H+S would have a field day. Plug fitments circa 1960. Ours was a Deluxe. I would hate to see the basic. Comprised of 2 beds covered in tatty old blankets (eiderdown was dated , manufactured1979!!) Bathroom grotty and depressing. Free parking was good as LA is a bit of a nightmare. Pool is the size of a postage stamp with just 3 loungers at the side of it. Was unfortunate enough to lose my wallet. asked for the number of LAPD and got some Prison in Ohio or God knows where. When eventually got some money wired over, asked for nearset Western Union and was directed to one that had been shut for 2 years! Gave up asking for anything as most of the time greeted with blank looks. would not stay again. Spent one night in Frisco, Hotel Capri, same price 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Place”
Reviews.Author: Fergi-Boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hoolywood Downtowner Inn at the start of our American trip. For the price we paid, it was very comfortable and provided a good base to see the sites of Hollywood. The Chinese Theatre was only 15 minutes walk down Hollywod Blvd. Reception was very quick and helpful and the breakfast was a bonus, as you don't often get breakfast included in American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Old & dated, not horrible, but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: au_trips
Reviews.Content: Motel is on Hollywood boulevard, but way downtown. Metro rail is close, but not a good place without a car. Free parking is great, rooms are very dated & depressing. Very noisy if people are staying in the room above. Pool NOT heated. Showers really bad, no water pressure & hot goes cold all the time !! Overall not great, not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “I'd certainly go back!”
Reviews.Author: onlysometimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in the Hollywood Downtowner over Christmas 2008. The owners were absolutely lovely, very friendly and helpful, and gave us some great tips on local places to eat and visit. The room was a great size for what we paid, and although it certainly wasn't a five star hotel, it was very clean and comfortable. It was about a 20 minute walk down Hollywood Blvd to where most of the action, which we didn't mind, because it was an interesting experience to walk down the Walk of Fame, etc. Note though that the breakfast is just a bunch of donuts and fruit in the reception area. Our vacation involved 5 countries and 6 hotels, and of all of them, this was the best value and service. I'd stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: westonbk
Reviews.Content: We initially chose this hotel based on price, location and reviews. We were very glad we did. The owners could not have been more helpful or accommodating if they tried. Our plans kept changing and we needed access to both Internet and Fax at short notice and awkward hours. The owners met our every need with no fuss and offered suggestions to help us overcome our problems. As in other reviews the decor is dated but it is in the midst of a makeover. The rooms are good size, clean, comfortable and have all the basics. They are not luxurious but well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nope, never again”
Reviews.Author: SydOhio
Reviews.Content: The owners seemed friendly, but that hardly made up for nights of no sleep due to parties in the hotel and a downright dirty room. Cheap yes. Far from the action, yes. Secure, no. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Owner was very rude”
Reviews.Author: sazgoodwin
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Downtowner Inn was a really good choice. I stayed there with my boyfriend for 2 nights. Its really near a METRO stop, only 2 stops to the main attractions and 3 stops to Universal Studios. The room was lovely, breakfast was great but I have to say the woman who owns the place is rude and [-] me off. At check in when she realised we were Irish, she insulted our country by telling us some friends of hers who moved there said "It rains all the time, theres nothing to do there, they hate it and can't wait to go back to the States." Not exactly a great welcome for international guests. I was offended by her comments but said nothing. Then upon checking out she noticed i have short nails (coz i bite them), she made a MASSIVE DEAL of informing me how unhygenic this was and i was nodding but no seriously she went on for like 15 mins saying that all the poison in your body was excreted through your nails (first I heard) and that ants (??) won't even eat human nails...she was totally dramatic about it and kept going "EWWW, OH MY GOD, THATS SO GROSS". I was really embarressed and enraged. I'm not saying don't stay here, I just thought my experience with her was so wierd, i wonder will she act like this with anyone else. She had absolutely no people skills, I don't know why she bothers working in hospitality. The End.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: leeseloo
Reviews.Content: we trawled through loads of reviews and eventually booked this place. it was really pretty good, above our expectations. breakfast was good, great for out teengers who love donuts. pool clean and safe. rooms large, a little bit dated but very comfy. this is in a good location within walking distance of the walk of fame, not many places to eat nearby though if you don't like thai. if you do like thai go and watch thai elvis, the very helpful lady on the desk, shayla i think she is called, will direct you. we had a lovely stay and were pleased we booked here. have to say though LA is beautiful in some areas but we were pretty shocked at how dirty the walk of fame was a little way from the chinese theatre, and be careful if you take pics of the characters around the theatre-they are ruthless!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AlbertaTraveller70
Reviews.Content: First trip to LA, stayed for three days the last week of July. Great location, free parking is a huge plus. Certainly not new but very clean and well maintained. Good value overall. On Hollywood Bvld but not really walking distance to anything, car is still recommended. That being said, pretty easy to get to any tourists spots (Universal, Beverly Hills, Walk of Fame etc.) Finally, we read reports of the area being sketchy. Never felt even the least bit uncomfortable, day or night. It's just older, not dangerous. If you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room then I highly recommend this hotel as home base to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: JagsNKY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually located in Hollywood, CA. It was a cute hotel, but the parking was very tight, as is all of Hollywood and L.A. We were in an area that was close enough to sightseeing in Hollywood, but far enough away from all the crowds. Our room appeared to be recently remodeled. It was small, but nice and mostly quiet; however, the beds were very hard and not very comfortable. There were pretty planters all around the pool area which was located in the inner part of the inn. (The rooms circled around the pool.) The owners were very accommodating - giving information about places to go, quickly helping when our refrigerator was broken, quickly bringing more pillows, etc. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, given the budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: midtowndawg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner Inn June 26-30, 2008 and had a good experience. I had read previous reviews and found the staff to be helpful, including changing my reservation. My room was clean and I appreciated the refrigerator and microwave. Its not the Taj-Mahal and the neighborhood is not the greatest, but its a good value for the money. I would stay there again. I took previous advice and asked for a room in the rear so I would not hear street noise. The pool looked inviting and was used by other guests. Parking is tight so a compact car would work better. Its overall location is its biggest benefit. The Metro Subway Station at Western Avenue is two blocks to the East (two stops to Hollywood at Highland and the Chinese Theater). The 101 Freeway is within a half mile to the West of the Inn on Hollywood Blvd and The Chinese Theater is about a mile or so away to the West. There is a Ralph's Supermarket across from the Metro Station as well as numerous Thai restaurants. There are several coffee shops nearby including Angel's next to the Days Inn just East of the Metro Station. There is A Sizzler just East of Angel's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Price, Great Managers”
Reviews.Author: sillysher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Downtowner for our entire week long holiday in LA. And had it not been for the location of the hotel, we would have had a difficult time getting around. No one walks in LA. Even the Sunset Strip people drive. The hotel was definatly dated, and our room had a funky stale/damp smell to it, but after a couple of days we didn't even notice. The area of the hotel is not the greatest of neighborhoods, but if you know that going there, then its not a surprise. The managment were very nice, and let us check in quite early as our flight got in before noon. We had fresh towels every morning, and our beds were made up every day. The breakfast was pretty simple, but the donuts were very tasty. There is the Metro station under 2 blocks away, a Ralph's grocery store and a Starbucks on the corner as well. Hollywood Blvd's Walk-of-Fame is within walking distance, but we didn't like having to walk so far back when the sun set. Take the Metro, 2 stops and you're in the heart of Hollywood. For the price and location this hotel is fantastic. We didn't use the pool, but it was well used while we were there. I will for sure be staying there again on my next visit to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Budget Choice”
Reviews.Author: Idunsford
Reviews.Content: We'd gone to LA to see some friends so we booked something cheap and basic but centrally located. Everyone says you need a car in LA but we found it fine without. The motel is just a block from the Hollywood/Western metro (the LA version of the Underground) and for a reasonable price you can buy an all day pass. Mann's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame are just two stops away - though it's easy enough to walk there too from the motel (a 15min walk). We caught the metro to Downtown on one day and it's also possible to get to Unviersal Studios on it too. There are two buses that stop close to the motel too that run a similair route. By the metro there's a supermarket and a Starbucks, in the other direction there's a good donut shop a couple blocks away and a few coffee shops. The motel itself is a little dated, but it does have a kitsch 60's charm - the sign out front is wonderful. There's a small pool which I used quite a bit and coffee and donuts are offered for breakfast (the donuts are really good). The rooms are pretty much what you'd expect of a motel - large beds, air con, tv, tea and coffee facilites etc. The rooms are a bit dated and a little rough around the edges but what do you expect for such a cheap price in a good location. I'd definately stay here again. Bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Was sent to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: ftp1234
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for 1 night over the phone.(We had a confirmation number, and had given them credit card info to hold the reservation). On reaching there, the lady at the reception said she had a 'good' surprise for us. I don't know what was 'good' about the surprise. She said she didn't have any vacancy, so she sent us to Dunes Inn, which was a mile away and told us that she had made arrangements there for us and that we would get the same nightly rate there. She made it sound as if this was an upgrade and Dunes Inn was a much better place. The problem is that at the Dunes Inn, the man at the reception gave us a smoking room (even though we had a reservation for Non-smoking room at the Hollywood Downtowner). I don't know if the lady had informed the Dunes Inn for a non-smoking room for us. On requesting the Dunes Inn person for a non-smoking room, he said this was the only room available. But the worse part is, he kept on insisting it was a non-smoking room. The housemaid who was walking by, later confirmed it was a smoking room and at least made our life a bit easier by spraying some room freshener that she had. Although the effect of the freshener didn't last long, we appreciate the housemaid's gesture. All I cared in my one night stay was that I get a basic clean, non-smoking odorless room, but we didn't get that. And this was because even after booking our stay at Hollywood Downtowner (which I assume had decent rooms according to tripadvisor reviews that I had read) and getting a confirmation number and giving my credit card info, they sent us somewhere else when we arrived. I am giving 2 stars just because the lady at Hollywood Downtonwer said that we could get breakfast at their hotel next morning if the Dunes Inn didn't provide any. So these 2 stars are for the breakfast we had.

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Ami89
Reviews.Content: The inn is not in a very good location- the neighbourhood is not great, however the hollywood walk of fame is only a 15 minute walk away. The inn itself could do with a makeover- our room was average- beds ok size, needs new bathrooms, lights could do with replacing, wardrobe door was hanging off. Good point of the inn were the owners- very friendly and helpful. Would probably not choose to stay here again but ok for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Money (if you're not too picky)”
Reviews.Author: tobeginwith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and for the price I was pleased. The hotel is located right on noisy Hollywood Blvd (fair to middling neighborhood) so, if possible book a room in the rear of the hotel. My room featured your basic 60s motor lodge furnishings - a little funky, very basic but clean. A tangles of cords for the microwave, fridge and lamps cluttered the corner of the room but for the price I paid ($70/night) it was totally acceptable, though possibly a fire code violation! The bed was firm and comfortable and the heater/a.c. unit, while noisy worked just fine. The front desk staff is helpful and polite, and they strive to run a legit place (no cash is accepted to keep out the hookers!) which is comforting. Most of the guests I saw were under 35, quiet and ethnically diverse -white, black, Asian. There's free parking (about 20 spaces and things are tight if you don't have a compact car) plus free wifi internet access, which worked like a charm. The pool looked clean and inviting but the weather prohibited me from taking a dip. The things that needed attention included a loose chain lock on the inside door that was completely worthless (they should install flip deadbolts on the inside of all the doors) and the lack of a shelf in the bathroom to put your toiletries. These are minor quibbles however. You could do much worse for the money in LA (like the Econo Lodge on Sunset Blvd) so if you're not too fussy this place will serve you well.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight layover”
Reviews.Author: AussieBarbie
Reviews.Content: Overall happy with hotel. Very basic, but clean. Youget what you pay for. The guy at the front desk, was so helpful. He could not do enough to help us. We had a room at the back, so we had a quiet night. Do not book a front room, it will be too noisy. Overall...really good place to stay for a layover in LA, on your way to somewhere else. Perhaps not recommended for a long term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ucangougeaway
Reviews.Content: You will love this place if you are in Hollywood to see the city. Its isnt a luxury hotel , i mean you can see that by the great price.So if you arnt a pampered poodle you will have a very nice stay. The staff was so nice. We had to check out a day early because of a death in the family and they didnt give us any problems. I would recomend it to all my friends and fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: ajrAdelaide
Reviews.Content: For the cost of a room I found this hotel a great place to stay. The rooms lacked nothing were clean and comfortable. There was a swimming pool and free off street parking which for me was important. The hotel is run by a family bussiness and I found them extremely friendly and helpful with information that any stranger to LA would want to ask. If they did not know at the time they would get back later. Use of computer for the net etc. was readily made available at no cost. I found the place quiet and would recommend it to any age group.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: hols100
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Downtowner was probably the most friendly hotel I've ever stayed at... it's a family run business and the front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful. Our room was large and clean, and the complimentary breakfast was excellent compared to most motels. They also didn't have any problem with allowing 4 adults to share the twin queen room (which is a problem we encountered at several other motels in the area). As for location, it's perhaps not ideal for young females to walk around alone at night, but for mixed groups it's perfect for the Walk of Fame and Chinese Theatre - just a 20-minute stroll away. I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone I know going to LA in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it... although it was not the cleanest place on earth...”
Reviews.Author: jewelzz111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night. The lady at the front desk was the nicest person ever. She gave us a map and showed us all kinds of places where we could go. Okay, the room was not the cleanest. The carpet was kinda filthy and so was the bathroom. But the bed and its linens were totally fine. The area itself is not the safest either - but the walk of fame and Chinese Theater are only a couple of driving mins away. We felt totally safe inside the hotel. Although the rooms were not the nicest, we still loved this motel because it was so cozy and the ppl were very nice. Plus: free breakfast, free internet, coffee maker, fridge hair dryer, tv and aircon in room. We didn't try the pool but it actually looked pretty nice. We're seriously thinking about staying here again in 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “seedy motel experience”
Reviews.Author: sprytle75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights thinking that this motel may be kitchy-cool-we were so wrong. When I booked the room I asked for a room with a balcony overlooking the pool and was told there was one availiable but when we arrived we were given a room with no balcony. The manager apoligized but there were no more rooms available. Also when we arrived at 4 pm our room was still being cleaned so had to wait downstairs with all of our luggage. When we entered the room and looked around we realized what a mistake we had made-the air conditioner was framed to the wall with unpainted wood and there was a hole in the ceiling where a pipe went through but it looked as though it had been punched through with a hammer. The closet doors were falling off and the tile at the bathroom entrance was all broken and crumbling with dirt and dust surrounding the broken tiles. The toilet seat was cracked and there was a big black filthy toilet plunger in the corner. When I opened the drawer next to the bed there was a food and condom wrapper in there! There were inexplicable holes drilled through the top of the large dresser too. The first morning there was no hot water and I had to take a cold shower. The couple on the other side of the wall screamed and cussed at eachother every night and all morning. The coolness of this hotel only goes as far as the googie sign in front, beyond that this motel is a dump. When I got home I felt as though I needed to decontaminate everything that I had brought with me.

Reviews.Title: “I miss this cozy place”
Reviews.Author: rlmk
Reviews.Content: Have read quite some negative reviews after i booked the place. anyhow, i simply think tis is one of the nicest place i've stayed. it is a simple cozy-looking motel room, fully furnished with the basics. we got a king non-smoking. bed is comfortable. we got free 24h wireless access for our stay which we used some to get some road directions. everything looks clean and neat. room is a bit small tho to hv good walking space or fit in more than 3big luggages. they hv free parking but no self-laundry facility. the big minus is tat it is a no-no to walk back on your own after 9pm on the hollywood blvd. even tho main road is litted with cars, you do not know who's lurking in the dark buildings. we walked back abt 9plus after a movie and the streets was quiet except for the vehicle traffic where we get a few loud rowdy drivers. few locals were makin their way home on the streets. summary, we will still return to stay except tat we will choose to drive if gg out late to hollywood blvd :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: sarahr14
Reviews.Content: My friend and I took a trip down to SoCal for her 20th birthday. We went to Disneyland one day and I wanted her to be able to do a bunch of SouthernCalifonia tourist-y things the next day. So I searched around Hollywood for hotels. We're both young and broke, so the Hollywood Downtowner was the most appealing, of course, based on it's super-cheap rates [especially in comparison to the rates of surrounding North Hollywood hotels]. I was definitely a little leary. Even though I fell in love with the look of the Hollywood Downtowner, after I read through EVERY review I could find... I got a little nervous. Too many reviewers painted this hotel to be a bedbug-ridden, stain-covered, blood-on-the-walls and vomit-in-the-stairway place in the middle of tons of criminal activity. And we were two twenty-year-old girls that were going to be arriving in the middle of the night. Oi. I was so enthusiastically satisfied with this hotel. The staff there are amazing. So friendly, personable, and helpful. You become friends with them instantly and feel comfortable with your stay as soon as you check in. Obviously, the accomodations are what they are for a $60 hotel room. Nothing too fancy; you've got pretty much the bare minimum... but who spends that much time in the hotel, anyway? You've got a clean, comfy place to sleep. And a high-pressure showerhead! It looks like a crummy showerhead... but it delivers some power! Such a nice change from most hotels. And if you're lacking in anything during your stay, again... the staff is super friendly and more than willing to accomodate what you need. The place has character. It's appearance is like something right out of a movie. Again... there's not much to your actual room, but it's a fantastic place to stay and we have absolutely no regrets. Not much for breakfast [cold/hot cereals, some fruit, packaged danishes, milk, coffee, and orange juice], so don't expect some grand breakfast rollout in their tiny lobby. I highly recommend the Hollywood Downtowner Inn to EVERYONE traveling on a budget... and to anyone looking to stay in a place with some character and great staff. I apologize for the long review. But after staying there I was determined to write a positive review to thank the staff of the Hollywood Downtowner Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location & Kitsch!”
Reviews.Author: faerona
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here Sept 17-19, 2006. We had a great time. We did not have any of the problems listed in other reviews here. The management/owners were very helpful, recommending 3 great, cheap restaurants and giving us driving directions for attractions. (Try the Thai one they recommend, cheap, delish and huge portions!) We went in the pool everyday. It is small and the hotel surrounds it so it only has direct light during the warmest hours...but that was fine with us. Our room was clean and had no problems. We had the room on the street with a balcony and we loved people-watching from there. Total kitsch, but great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and charming”
Reviews.Author: olddave
Reviews.Content: after a week at the Luxor in Las Vegas my wife and I were not expecting anything in the way of luxury from the Downtowner but we were pleasantly surprised by the charm of the place and found it just what we wanted for a couple of nights. The room 12A was upstairs at the back overlooking the pool and in a nice quiet location, it was always clean and tidy with the usual coffee maker etc.Bharat was pleasant and helpful and pointed out the best trips and restaurants close by. There were a couple of decent Thai restaurants about 400 yards east and a good steak house across the road from those. Also a nice breakfast place close to the Days Inn. We will have no hesitation in staying there again when the time comes. DH

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Bed Bugs in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WilsonW
Reviews.Content: Last Visit:September 2006. The hotel is not clean. We were bitten by bed bugs in Room 6 on Sep 1st 2006. We killed about two dozen bugs which left blood marks everywhere on the bed sheets. The hotel managers blamed that the bugs were brought in by the guests who stayed in the room earlier. I don't believe him at all because there were so many bugs in that room. The manager refused to fully refund us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Matt The G
Reviews.Content: Whilst I agree with some of the previous postings about the noise, dodgy surroundings and stale rooms, the big plus this motel has going for it is the great customer service. A great warm welcome in a city that can sometimes be a touch cold, intimidating and too cool for school (see The Vibe Motel). No great bars nearby but Hollywood isn't too far a walk westwards (check out The Frolic Room) but would advise getting a taxi home - area becomes a bit daunting after dark, especially as you have to cross over the top of a busy freeway. Close to Metro stop and shopping mall to the east. Worth asking for a room upstairs and at the front if you want to hang out on the balcony and people watch below - chose a room at the back if you want to sleep though. Great free breakfast too and free internet access. If you're on a budget, you could do a lot worse than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Err there are ups and downs to this motel”
Reviews.Author: jma52
Reviews.Content: OK I am going to try and point out both positive and negative aspects of this motel (it is not a hotel, this is drive up in your car to room motel kind of place). Which was my first problem with the surrounding area; I arrived from downtown via the subway and this was my first visit to Hollywood. Well this part of it is not glamorous at all. It looked pretty scary actually and I didn't even know which direction to go. I have to give a local woman a big thank you. She pointed out the direction and got me onto the right bus. Whew. A big plus to this local which was a pleasant surprise. I arrived at the motel and the area was very ghetto looking. I was happy for the liquor store across the street because my nerves were a bit shaken by the gang style looking folks hanging out around the area and needed a drink. Or two. Now to the motel itself. It is pretty seedy - not kept up well, rather noisy window a/c units and a bit of a rank odor to the rooms. More of mold then urine - I could live with that. I did feel that the staff, who were VERY nice to me kept a good eye on the place and I did feel safe. They were also very helpful in pointing out how to get to various places. I slept ok and trusted the staff to keep out any riff raff which they did. And there were no vermin or that kind of thing. But all in all I would probably never stay here again. I would go father to the west where the neighborhood is less frightening looking and probably pay a couple extra dollars as I was here on a short vacation & the room really was not a place to hang out in other then for sleeping. The pool was also not filled but I probably wouldn't have used it anyway. I probably wouldn't have been quite as shook up upon my initial arrival if I had drove up in a car. If you have the least bit of a disdain for anything not modern look elsewhere. It is shabby and not 'shabby-chic'.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see movie stars”
Reviews.Author: eat my dust
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels on Hollywood Blvd. Down a few blocks from the Kodak Theater..they had the red carpet out for the Independent Film Awards..saw many ,many movie stars..and my car was parked next to Paris Hilton`s car..can you say "photo op "?This is not a 5 star hotel..and you are not paying 5 star rates !!! Clean room ,nice pool area...that you won`t have time to use !! Helpful front desk, smaller hotel so it is quiet,2 floors..no elavater. You can`t beat the location for the $$. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: lipsticktraces
Reviews.Content: If saving money is your priority, this is a great option. Nice staff, free breakfast, HBO on the tube, Metro station and buses just outside. Some folks will find the neighborhood a bit dicey, and if you are sensitive to noise, get a room away from the street (or if you like to watch cars drive by, get a room up front with a patio overlooking Hollywood Blvd.) Liquor store across the street, fast food and a cute coffee place within walking distances. Free parking and WiFi; very near freeway entrance. Big comfy bed, writing/dining table with chairs. Minuses: it's old, paint is peeling, shower only, air conditioner is loud, no screen on patio door, pool isn't clean enough to use (in the off season). I would stay here again to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I thought it would be. A funky west hollywood motel experience. down the street from some great hollywood landmarks and just minutes away from Universal studios. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. Some great Thai restaraunts within walking distance as well as some great characters along the street. Area not for everyone, Eclectic is a word I would describe it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit expensive for a low end hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westumbria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite old, but they seem to have done some basic renovations to the rooms and courtyard: new Bathroom tile and fixtures, new carpet. The furniture is still very 1960s. The staff seems to be an Indian family--I found the staff to be quite helpful. The location is OK for a budget hotel, but you can find better places in the same price range and significantly nicer places (ie: Holiday Inn) for $20 more per night. If you are in need of budget accomodation, or your budget is tight, this is an good choice. If you call them directly you can probably negotiate a slightly better price than what you will find with the online booking services.

Reviews.Title: “Great city, terrible motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this place for 10 days. Rude staff, filthy room. Had a amazing time in LA so i wasn't too bothered about staying here. Even went to stay with some friends for a few days. I come from a dodgy part of London so the area the motel is in didn't bother me too much, and walking is good for you, so that was ok. Got around by bus & metro really well by calling the MTA helpline and they plan your journey for you. The staff at the motel were very unhelpful & rude. And as for the room..had it ever been cleaned? As for a fridge in the room.. Didn't bother with the 'coffee and doughnuts' as there's a pretty cool cafe down just a few minutes away. Do yourself a favour and pay a few extra bucks and stay somewhere decent. The liquor store across the street was convinient though!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised considering the price”
Reviews.Author: lori62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2005. Picked it for location and price $59 a night. Our room was a decent size with king size bed, tv, fridge and coffee maker. Bathroom was adequate with a large shower. I found the room to be clean and comfortable. Breakfast was merely free coffee and a donut picked up from reception which was fine. The hotel is situated near the metro and was 2 stops to Manns chinese theatre, cost $1.25 each way. I have to say that the a/c unit was very noisy but luckily we didn't need to use it much. The pool looked nice and clean but we didn't use it as we were out all day. The free parking was great as we tended to leave the car at the hotel and use the metro for convenience. I would recommend this place for location if you don't want to spend out too much on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Sign, Even Funkier (and Disgusting) Motel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous68
Reviews.Content: Do not be deceived by the funky, 1960s-era sign outside this motel. This is one of the seediest, most run-down places you will stay. We rented a room in which the air conditioner was literally TAPED to the wall; it was so clotted with years of dust that the air that blew out of it was suffocating. The room also smelled of gas due to a leak in the heater; for some reason, the window was boarded up by wood paneling. Although the room had a sliding door, which was off-kilter and caked with dirt, we were in no mood to keep it open that night, due to the dubious quality of the surrounding area. The room's carpet was so filthy that we kept our shoes on the entire time, and the bathroom was in abominable condition. Just outside, the motel's big, starry retro sign blinked fitfully all night, staining the coarse, stained curtains a lurid orange. Across the street from the motel is an overgrown, trash-strewn lot and a liquor store, along with some bedraggled palm trees. The night we stayed, a man lingered in the shadows near the dark alley. Meanwhile, the sounds of men and a woman--resembling the soundtrack to a gang rape--filtered through the vent. Not a good night's sleep at all. This place is only suitable for writers desperately seeking "local color" (i.e., the sadder, seamier side of Hollywood) or for johns desiring a tawdry affair with a prostitute. Definitely not for those seeking a pleasant sojourn in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right on Hollywood Blvd, close to the subway and bus stops which were a great form of transportation at Hollywood and Western. For a $3 day pass you can ride the bus and subway almost anywhere in LA. I took the bus to Malibu one day, Culver City the next, starting one block from the hotel for $3 there and back. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, they could get numbers for you or anything you need. It was a great place sleap after a long day at Hollywood and Highland to see the Chinese Museum or after going anywhere that there is to see in the Hollywood area. The rooms were very nice, better then any online description. I stayed in the king size bed room with a refrigerator, which was nice and had air conditioning. The rooms could pass for being in a chain hotel. The pool was in a good location right in the center to use, and a good size, although it was too cold to use in March. There is free covered parking although we didn't have a car. This hotel was a great deal for the price, don't waste more money on a chain because this could be one. The only downside is that there is a limited cable network, probabley 6 channels. The area is not bad, but we didn't go out walking real late, which probabley isn't a good idea. During the day the area is a lot nicer. I would definately stay here again if I came back to Hollywood, and if you are looking for a good deal in Hollywood this is a great choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Downtowner Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 5601 Hollywood Boulevard, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
